The Gift that Keeps on Giving

Launched on 1 March 2022, the SIT-Polytechnic Innovation Centre of Excellence (SPICE) supports companies, especially local small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs), in their innovation journeys and develops new products/services and talent in the process.

Supported by Enterprise Singapore, SPICE collaborates with the various Centres of Innovation (COIs) at the Polytechnics and the Applied Research Centres (ARCs) at SIT to help companies move up the innovation value chain. The first of its kind, this university-polytechnic partnership will provide companies access to an expanded suite of complementary expertise, skill sets and facilities from SIT and the Polytechnics to co-create innovative solutions.
Access to domain experts and technical professionals to help companies innovate.
Access to facilities and equipment, thus lowering upfront investment and risk.
Access to a diverse talent pool and inter-disciplinary resources.
Value creation with new or improved products and services.
Assess potential/viability of new products and services for scale-up and commercialisation.
Internet of Things and Industrial Internet of Things

SPICE supports companies in propelling their transformation plans through an expanded suite of complementary expertise, skill sets and facilities jointly offered by SIT’s Applied Research Centres, overseas university partners and participating Polytechnics.
Centre for Infrastructure and Tunnel Engineering (CITE)
Centre of Innovation for Complementary Health Product (COI-CHP)
Tech Clinic: Driving Towards a Sustainable Food Production

SPICE and the Environmental & Water Technology Centre Of Innovation (EWTCOI) jointly organised a Tech Clinic for Sustainable Food Production. The event welcomed partners from the food manufacturing industry. Participants learned how to accelerate innovation and turn ideas into sustainable solutions. Attendees from the local food manufacturing industry gained valuable insights on how SPICE and EWTCOI can empower businesses to thrive and enhance innovation.
Enhance Your Competitive Edge Through Innovation

Organised by the SIT-Polytechnic Innovation Centre of Excellence and the Singapore National Employers Federation, the ‘Enhance Your Competitive Edge Through Innovation’ event saw over 70 participants from local SMEs. Participants gained valuable insights from our speakers, who shared their experience working with SPICE and how we helped to create value for them.

article_texts:
SIT-Polytechnic Innovation Centre of Excellence
Launched on 1 March 2022, the SIT-Polytechnic Innovation Centre of Excellence (SPICE) supports companies, especially local small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs), in their innovation journeys and develops new products/services and talent in the process.
Supported by Enterprise Singapore, SPICE collaborates with the various Centres of Innovation (COIs) at the Polytechnics and the Applied Research Centres (ARCs) at SIT to help companies move up the innovation value chain. The first of its kind, this university-polytechnic partnership will provide companies access to an expanded suite of complementary expertise, skill sets and facilities from SIT and the Polytechnics to co-create innovative solutions.
Value to Industry
Access to domain experts and technical professionals to help companies innovate.
Access to facilities and equipment, thus lowering upfront investment and risk.
Access to a diverse talent pool and inter-disciplinary resources.
Value creation with new or improved products and services.
How We Support Companies
Step 1:
Scope problem statements with companies
Step 2:
Jointly ideate and conceptualise solutions
Step 3:
Co-create new products and services
Step 4:
Assess potential/viability of new products and services for scale-up and commercialisation.
Our Team

SPICE supports companies in propelling their transformation plans through an expanded suite of complementary expertise, skill sets and facilities jointly offered by SIT’s Applied Research Centres, overseas university partners and participating Polytechnics.

Past Events
Tech Clinic: Driving Towards a Sustainable Food Production
19 July 2023
SPICE and the Environmental & Water Technology Centre Of Innovation (EWTCOI) jointly organised a Tech Clinic for Sustainable Food Production. The event welcomed partners from the food manufacturing industry. Participants learned how to accelerate innovation and turn ideas into sustainable solutions. Attendees from the local food manufacturing industry gained valuable insights on how SPICE and EWTCOI can empower businesses to thrive and enhance innovation.
Enhance Your Competitive Edge Through Innovation
14 Oct 2022
Organised by the SIT-Polytechnic Innovation Centre of Excellence and the Singapore National Employers Federation, the ‘Enhance Your Competitive Edge Through Innovation’ event saw over 70 participants from local SMEs. Participants gained valuable insights from our speakers, who shared their experience working with SPICE and how we helped to create value for them.
